channel.title: Small computer problem, but it's sooo annoying!
channel.description:
Image: http://img339.imageshack.us/img339/7605/weird2ts.jpg
Whenever I open My Computer and try to open my C drive, my computer starts to instantly search it. This is some weird tweak I did (it's not in any of my tutorials), but it's driving me nuts and I don't know what tweak it was. If anyone has found a website with someone having the same problem, that would be great. I already searched on google, no one seems to have the same problem, or I just need to be able to search better. If anyone could help, that would be great. :)
~Ron

item.title: Small computer problem, but it's sooo annoying!
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote author=Ron link=topic=4311.msg43776#msg43776 date=1149541385]
lol ipl0x.

Well I fixed the problem using a new program called WinXP Tweak Manager. I’ll be adding a tutorial and a free program download for that soon. All I did to reset it was go through this nifty program, and click on Reset Harddrive Context Menus. Checked back and wooosh there was the Open command right at the top.

I would still like to know how to fix that problem manually. I’m not sure if it was in the registry or what…

~Ron

look two posts above you (a.k.a my second post in this tread) and you’ll knoe how to solve it manually ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Small computer problem, but it's sooo annoying!
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

pcanswers.co.uk:

It sounds like Windows has somehow garbled its default action when double-clicking files. To fix the problem, youâ€™ll need to edit the Registry: click Start -> Run, type regedit and press [Enter]. Browse to the following key: HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT \ Drive \ shell. Double-click the (Default) value in the right-hand pane and change its value from Find to none. Now browse to HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT \ Directory \ shell and verify that its (Default) value is also set to none (change it if it isnâ€™t). Once done, close Registry Editor and you should be able to access your files normally again.

says for files but should work for u 2 ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Small computer problem, but it's sooo annoying!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I have resource hacker, and I just opened explorer.exe in it and searched for Open. But it wasn’t there. There many instances of Open though. I checked each one, and they were all in long sentences, I’m guessing for help and what not.

I don’t think it’s in the .exe, I think it’s in the regestry. Any more help would be greatly appreciated lol. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Small computer problem, but it's sooo annoying!
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I have not ran into that problem, so I cannot directly help you. I can however, recommend that you google things like “change right click menu order” or “change context menu item order.” Then you can make “Open” be before “Search.”

Sorry for not being of more help.
